thread.title: Bill Kristol tweet: 'Biden confirms to Obama'
thread.title_full: Bill Kristol tweet: 'Biden confirms to Obama'

author: Cheryl Chumley
title: Bill Kristol tweet: 'Biden confirms to Obama'
text:
Text bigger This tweet from pundit and writer Bill Kristol went out Tuesday. 
Bill Kristol, Washington, D.C., political pundit, writer and insider, sent out a tweet early Tuesday morning that ratchets up talk about a Joe Biden presidential run even further, saying the vice president will be confirming to President Obama today he is seeking the high office. 
The tweet: “Biden confirms to Obama at lunch today he’s running, announces at U. Delaware tomorrow. You can feel the Joementum!” 
The tweet sent around 10:30 a.m., didn’t make clear if Biden had already confirmed that fact to Obama at an early lunch, or if Biden was due to confirm that run to Obama at a looming lunch hour. 
But the message only furthers what’s been reported in recent hours about a likely Biden run. 
When it comes to goofy gaffes and dimwitted declarations, nobody does it better than America’s most beloved uncle figure, smilin’ Joe Biden. “Biden Time: Crazy Uncle Joe In His Own Words” chronicles his most memorably moronic or misfired quotes over the last 40-plus years 
As WND previously reported , sources have been confirming for days the vice president was going to jump in the race. 
A Pennsylvania congressman, Rep. Brendan Boyle, tweeted just this week: “I have a very good source close to Joe that tells me VP Biden will run for Prez.” And Ed Henry with Fox News tweeted in that same time frame three sources told him Biden was definitely running and was probably going to make it official during a planned October 24 event in Iowa. 
Yet another source who recently traveled with Biden’s son, Joseph Hunter, told WND on Monday the vice president was definitely going to seek the White House. Text smaller
